thread.title: Tony Pulis warns angry Arsenal fans Arsene Wenger could still be Gunners boss in FIVE years' time
thread.title_full: Tony Pulis warns angry Arsenal fans Arsene Wenger could still be Gunners boss in FIVE years' time

author: irishmirror
title: Tony Pulis warns angry Arsenal fans Arsene Wenger could still be Gunners boss in FIVE years' time
text:
Sport Tony Pulis warns angry Arsenal fans Arsene Wenger could still be Gunners boss in FIVE years' time Wenger heads for The Hawthorns under mounting pressure to quit the Gunners when his contract expires this summer Share Pulis believes Wenger will need to be carried away 'in a box' (Photo: David Price) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Tony Pulis claims football nut Arsene Wenger will have to be carried out of the game “in a box”. 
And the West Brom boss has warned angry Arsenal fans that the Frenchman could be staying at the Emirates for another five years. 
Wenger heads for The Hawthorns under mounting pressure to quit the Gunners when his contract expires this summer. 
He hasn’t won away against a Pulis team in seven years - and that 2010 success remains his ONLY victory in seven attempts. 
But Pulis, who regularly tormented Wenger while boss at Stoke, believes his rival is in no mood to walk away from management - and that won;t change whatever happens today. Pulis' Baggies host Wenger and Arsenal on Saturday (Photo: REUTERS) The Arsenal boss is under huge pressure (Photo: AFP) 
“I get the feeling that Arsene most probably wants to be carried out in a box still managing a football club because that’s the way he is,” said Pulis. 
“He’s football nuts. I really do think people at Arsenal trust him and they’ve given him total trust. 
“I think he’s a great manager and he’s been fantastic. 
“He will go down in history as the greatest manager Arsenal have had and you’re probably talking about a manager who wants to manage for another five or six years by the sounds of it. 
“He’s still managing one of the great teams in Europe and they could finish in the top four and win the FA Cup.” 
Pulis became public enemy number one in Arsenal fans’ eyes in 2010 when a reckless tackle from Stoke’s Ryan Shawcross left Aaron Ramsey with a badly-broken leg. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
